content: Something to keep Bill occupied? quote: ++http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/americas/8056762.stm] Bill Clinton to be UN Haiti envoy Storms caused some $1bn in damage to Haiti in 2008 Bill Clinton is to be the new UN special envoy to Haiti, a spokesman for the former US president said. Mr Clinton was quoted by the Miami Herald newspaper as saying he would be honoured to accept the position. He would work to help Haiti rebuild after last year's tropical storms which claimed the lives of nearly 800 people and caused $1bn (£660m) in damage. The UN is expected to confirm Mr Clinton's new role. The ex-leader helped raise funds for Haiti recently. In March, he visited the country along with UN Secretary General Ban Ki-moon, spurring a global fundraising effort which raised more than $300,000 for Haiti's rebuilding effort. Because of Mr Clinton's marriage to US Secretary of State Hillary Clinton, US state department lawyers must authorise his new role... (...)

title: Bill Clinton to be UN envoy to Haiti
